Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pedro S
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stay at this hotel and I am not disappointed with the service provided by the staff. The breakfast is very basic. The room was very clean and quiet and the neighborhood is safe. The only thing that can make this hotel better is a lift if you stay on the third floor or above. A few steps from the hotel there is a big supermarket and the historic ice cream factory “Palazzo del Freddo” and enjoy the delicious ice cream they. The place is very popular and we went there every night. The hotel has Wi-Fi in the Lobby but it will be a plus if they can make possible to have access from the rooms. The hotel is close to many important places and the Termini station. You can walk to the Colosseum from the hotel (about 15 minutes), just follow Viale Manzonni but I recommend you NOT to stop if somebody try to ask you for direction pretending being a lost tourist. That is an old trick that would happen anywhere in Rome and the trick consist in stopping the victim to distract him or her by showing a map or dropping something on purpose while the accomplices try to pickpocket or grab the purse. Just ignore them and continue walking and they will not bother you. This tip applies anywhere you stay in Rome or other countries.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CellisLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with fantastic modernised rooms and on suite bathrooms. Travelled to Rome with my boyfriend in March and really loved this hotel! Slightly out of the way from attractions although you can walk to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and the Colluseum within half an hour with ease and there are plenty of authentic Italian restraunts within walking distance. Can be quite noisy in the room from traffic and trams that seem to run all night but if you can sleep on a washing line like me you will be fine. Staff are really friendly and the hotel bar serves a glass of wine for one euro and local beer for three euros.. What more can you ask for! Will defiantly return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natilia77
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Termini station from Fiumicino airport thinking that the hotel was walking distance from Termini station as it was shown in the map that I printed off the hotel website. Although it is not far it is not easy to walk to the hotel from termini specially carrying luggage. It is only 1 tube station from Termini but it was not easy to find! Once we got there we found out that it was on the first floor and there was no lift. The room was big, clean and comfortable, however the noise from the traffic was pretty bad. The staff were very helpful. The breakfast was basic but nice. One of the good things about this hotel is that is walking distance from the Colosseum and some of the major attractions. It is also well communicated by tube. The area is not too bad but we also felt safe even when returning late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tbezzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. There is a $2.00 per person per day fee for city taxes. The younger staff at the front desk was nice and helpful. The older front desk staff was not as friendly and not as helpful. Ask any of your questions to the younger person if possible. This hotel is on busy street. All night all you hear are cars, buses, rail street cars, and motor scooters. Whew!!! Other than that the hotel was nice. The lady in the dining area was nice and the food was mostly breads with butter or cheese. There was also a orange juice machine and a coffee machine. There is a lift but it is not in the main building of the front desk. The hotel is close to the metro. The main attractions are only four or five metro stops away. To catch the metro is only 1 euro one way. I don't know how much is cost to catch the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves another star!”
Reviews.Author: annhedgehog
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a Birthday surprise for my husband for 4 nights. Listed as a 2* and was a little worried having read some of its previous reviews. However, the hotel was easy to find from Termini and is in a great location. All tourist attractions within walking distance - even walked to the Vatican, across the other side of the river. Some great and inexpensive restaurants near by but you do have to look very hard to find them! Hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. Our room was huge and we even had a small balcony! Only downside was the appalling breakfast - bread, bread and more bread (usually stale) and tea / coffee out of a machind which never really got hot. A brilliant choice if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: Georgi1333
Reviews.Content: We returned home from the Taormina Hotel on 7 March. I have to admit that Rome was not as expected! Like any city, there are rougher areas and this hotel appeared to be on the outskirts of such an area. We were in a separate part of the hotel just of a main street on the third floor. The room was lovely and had everything that you needed for a short stay. the staff were also lovely and spent a great deal of time to make us feel welcome and mark a map out of all the best places to go and see. There were two metro stations very close by and the Termini is about 10 minutes down the road. From there you can get trains to various places and there is also a metro station here too. All the metro stations are quite clearly marked and there are only two lines so it is difficult to mess up so badly that you cannot get back! The metro is quite a scary experience if you are a first timer - especially at rush hour (7-10am). We were told to go to the Vatican early on in the morning and were a little shocked to find that you are packed so tightly onto the tube that people actually push you in and help close the doors behind you!! That being said, you can time your watch by them and they are so reliable and quick, I would definately recommend getting a ticket for the length of your stay. Vatican is AMAZING. I was walking around with tears in my eyes its so breathtaking. Don't overly panic about the dress code either - like we did! We were of the impression that we needed to look extra smart and we actually looked very daft! It is not as strict as people make out, just be respectful - dont wear shorts or inappropriate tops. I am sorry to say that I was a little disappointed in the Sistine Chapel. Its obviously a must see, but don't expect to be astounded - especially after seeing the rest of Rome. For a 2 star hotel, I would recommend this for the value for money. However, bear in mind that you will not be in the best looking area! You will be closest to the colleseum and everywhere is in walking distance. Myself and my partner walked around the entire of Rome (apart from Vatican) and I'd say that it was a great way to see it. There are so many hidden treasures that you notice when you are walking around. Its certainly worth losing the map for a day and just getting yourself lost amidst the melee of it all...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - one piece of advice”
Reviews.Author: mickfirman
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in March 2012. Hotel is 15 minute walk from Termini station. Good points - very helpful reception staff, firm but comfortable bed, room clean and tidy, free internet in reception, adjacent to bus/tram/subway stops. Restaurants are circa 100 metres away, next to hotel are clothes shops. Not so good points - noise from trams/traffic on main roads. Breakfast is very basic - plate with 1 medium and 2 small fresh rolls on table. Jams, butter, etc available as well as croisants, ryebreads. Some German visitors were bringing in their own cheeses/meats to supplement. Coffee/tea and juice available from "vending" type machines - not the finest quality. Would have liked a tea/coffee making facilities in the room but you can get them from reception. One piece of advice - get a Rome Pass card (30 euros) - gives 3 days free bus/tram/subway travel but the best bit is skipping the massive queue at the Colosseum and its free entry. You can purchase a tour (5 euro) or an audioguide (5.5 euro) when inside but show the pass.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dewey015
Reviews.Content: Being close to the Termini station and within about walking distance to explore the old town and tourist areas, the hotel perfectly suited our needs for a two night stay. I had requested a room to the back of the hotel which we were given. Despite the bed being the firmest I have ever slept on, the room was very clean and a nice size. With a basic breakfast included and free internet in the lobby, the hotel was fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Petr T
Reviews.Content: excellent location, very clean, friendly and helpfull staff, close to the station and the best icecream in Rome just a minute from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “warm friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesley d
Reviews.Content: excellent location,,spotless hotel,,european breakfast not up to much but nice all the same,,the rooms are excellent very clean and warm,,although very hard beds,,the hotel staff are faultless they are very friendly and helpful especially manual,,excellent hotel for couples families ,,easy reach to the station,,and cafe bars,,very warm welcome from the TAVERNA staff cheap and cheerful little italian bistro just round the corner from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Nice Staff, central location and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Karlene M H
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading previous reviews and looking at their website, it was easily found just a ten minute walk from the main termini. When we arrived the reception guy was really friendly and showed us to our room ( there was a few flights of stairs but we are only in our 20's so wasn't too much hassle) it may not be so good for older people. The room was in the newer block and was of good size and the bathroom/shower etc were really good for a 2* hotel, i would rate it 3* with no hesitation. the road can be a little noisy as the trams run by but after a bust day sight seeing i had no trouble falling asleep. the breakfast was very basic but fresh, a mixture of breads, croissants jams etc, and juice tea and coffee. The bar prices in the hotel are really cheap and my boyfriend loved the cappucinos. There is a great ice cream place a few doors down and also a cheap takeaway over the road for a quick tasty snack. There is a metro staion called emanuelle just at the end of the street where you can get to just about anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Gray_1976
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for exploring Rome. Close to Termini & the Metro its a good base for exploring from whilst being just a little bit out the centre that keeps the cost down. Also has a really great ice cream bar just along the street - highly recomended !! The hotel was clean, staff very friendly and rooms good aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Beado
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend and found it to be great - and half the price of everthing else that I looked at. Really good location for getting about in Rome. The breakfast is limited (I then moved to 4* hotel for work and it was much the same though) but fine. The staff are really helpful - my flight was very delayed and I emailed them to let them know and they got straight back and they really do man the reception 24/7. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: aww3583
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in September of 2011. Our room was in the "newer" part of the hotel. The furnishings and decor appeared to be brand new. The bed was firm but comfortable and the bathroom was great. The room was very clean and quiet. We had to pay 5-Euros per night for air conditioning which was the most frustrating part of our stay. I had to get used to using the key to work the lights, but it wasn't a hassle at all. The front desk all spoke some English and were great to talk to. We were referred to restaurants and sites throughout the city. The walk from the train station is less than 5 minutes and we never felt unsafe. The neighborhood is great, especially with the giant gelato shop just down the block. The TV had a lot of channels, but no English-speaking ones. But, we didn't come to Rome to watch TV in our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “good-value hotel in an interesting neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CWU
Reviews.Content: our Rom trip was a gift so we did not know what kind of hotel we were going to stay. The location is good, close to the main train station and metro station. We were not surprised when we stepped in the nothing-special hotel lobby because it suits the 2 * hotel image. We found it amusing that our room was actually in another building but it was nice because the whole apartment from inside looks like the one in the movie "The Professional". Upon arrival we chose a room with air conditioning (costs 5 Euro extra) since it was early September and it was quite hot during the day. We were very pleased with our room since everything looks like brand new. No scratch on the wall and very clean. The only thing i missed is the water cooker but who needs it when you can free water or caffe for less than 1 Euro in the great ice cafe next door . The staff is quite helpful and friendly. Try the Korean restaurant Bi Won if you want to try something different. Take a walk in the neighborhood to see the real Rom. Just do not have much expectation with the breakfast. It was really not good. I would definitely stay here again if I visit Rom in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuili
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel for the price. The staff were absolutely wonderful and the room was huge!!! We had a small balcony with a view of the courtyard. Our room was in a building adjacent to the actual hotel. In the actual hotel, you have to go up one set of stairs to the lobby. My advise, when checking in do not bring your luggage upstairs to the lobby. The staff may help you bring it up if your room is in the main building, and if you stay in the adjacent building, there is an elevator in the building. Air conditioning was 5 Euro's per day but it works really well!! There is a free computer in the lobby for your use, as they don't have wifi. Breakfast is very basic, rolls, juice, coffee. It is a short walk from Termini Station and Piazza Vittorio. If you stay here, don't forget to visit nearby Santa Maria Maggorio Church. I believe it is the oldest church in Rome, free, beautiful and houses the remains of Jesus' manger.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget option”
Reviews.Author: jellyfishkitten
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel and we were totally happy with it for the price we paid. The hotel room was clean and spacious and the bathroom was a good size. Air conditioning was 5 euro extra per night and it worked well (maybe a little too well - it was actually a bit cold!). There was a computer in a communal area that was available for guests to use and this was quite handy. Some reviewers have complained about the stairs but we only had to lug our cases up one short flight to get to the reception so it wasn't too bad at all. The breakfast was a bit of a disappointment though. The dining area was quite small and we ended up waiting a while for a table one morning when they were busy. There was not much of a choice - mostly bread, jam, crackers, chocolate spread, etc. and the coffee and juice was from a machine. The location is a bit rough and run down but I never felt unsafe. The hotel is about 10 - 15 minutes walk from Termini and only a 2-3 minute walk from the metro station. However, when we stayed in July 2011, the metro wasn't running past 9 pm. There was a replacement bus service (to Termini as far as I know) but we didn't use it. I'm pretty sure this restriction is in place until April 2012 although I could be wrong. All negatives aside, we were generally quite happy with this hotel and we found the staff friendly and helpful. I would probably stay again but would definitely look into other options for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Really good 2* hotel at Rome (seems like 3*+ hotel)”
Reviews.Author: lindawelsa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there 3 nights + hotel rooms are renovated and such level didn`t expected at 2* hotel (rooms are in 4* hotel level) + free wi-fi zone and use of computer on reception area + helpful staff at reception + very near to Termini and historical center - breakfast - just bread, jam and cheese, coffee and juice (miss a bit of sausage etc.) But as understood from hotel staff, they would like to be 3* hotel - so they have started hotel changes with room renovation

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for you budget trip to the Eternal City!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alessandrina79
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an unforgettable trip to Rome!!! We stayed at Taormina Hotel for 4 days and I could say it was more than a pleasant surprise! I read the reviews but I thought that they were a bit boosted for a cheap hotel in the center if Rome. Just the opposite- one can add even more superlatives! The rooms are nice, the bathrooms - extremely clean. They change the towels and clean the rooms every day. The breakfast is repetitive, quite a lot of sweet things - but after all it's a two-star budget hotel, so it's better than nothing. The staff is great - friendly, helpful, they can give you lots of information and directions. Free internet access in the lobby, not in the rooms. "Taormina" has it all - nice clean rooms, great staff, convenient location and reasonable prices! The only drawback for us was the noise from the street - it is impossible to sleep having the windows open!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE ROOMS! LOVELY BATHROOMS!! ASK FOR THE ELEVATOR! Breakfast not so great.”
Reviews.Author: misundrstd
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were beautiful! They had AC but you had to pay extra for it. When you enter the front door of the hotel you are greeted with a set of stairs. Don't panic, there is an elevator through the big brown door on your left outside the main entrance. Breakfast was not that great. It was a little tricky getting to our room at times because the building houses 2-3 hotels and apt complexes that share the elevator. Ask for specific directions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean middle class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fitbear
Reviews.Content: Nice middle class hotel in very good and very clean condition. Centralyl located in an area with a lot of chinese immigration. Not an unsafe area though. Close to metro, tram and bus. Walking distance from Termini station. If you arrive from Fiumicino airport by train (Leonardo Express), take the first exit ("uscita"), go downstairs to Via Giolitti, there is an elevator too. Don't walk all the way to the end of the tracks, that makes a big shortcut. And don't miss "Fassi", Italy's famous and oldest ice cream manufactory almost next door from Hotel Taormina, on Via Principe Eugenio.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: maryetta80
Reviews.Content: Entirely adequate to needs of a traveler. Exceptionally clean, private bathroom, comfortable beds. Close to sites and to transportation. Great fluffy towels. Helpful staff who speak English. No frills, and breakfast is boring, but coffee is good. Expect some stairs. Less than $100.00 per day in May 2011. I was on the courtyard at the back, and this could be noisy in the evening, but everything quieted down by 9:30, even on Saturday. I stayed two weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Price was good. Otherwise just serviceable.”
Reviews.Author: bhancey
Reviews.Content: For a discount hotel this was fine. Good: Price. Friendly staff. Bad: Not a great part of Rome, but we did not feel unsafe. --you will be walking a fair amount from here to anywhere historic. Stinky bathroom Hard Bed No Internet (really, how do you not have internet in the 21st century). Pass the bread --breakfast was rolls, more rolls, and a few condiments.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline91980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as I was on a budget during the rugby season. The hotel was so smart I did not feel like I was on a budget. The rooms and hotel should be more that a 2 star. I would definately stay here again and in fact will be booking for 2 years time. The are is basic but there is a tram that stops outside the hotel which takes you to the centre and the metro is about 50 yards away. The staff were very helpful and polite. Breakfast was not great but at the price we paid, we couldnt grumble. As my title says, perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our rome holiday”
Reviews.Author: d a
Reviews.Content: We arrived at rome we drove through a lot of areas on our way to this hotel this hotel is located by the termni station it is a slighty rougher part of rome but to be honest unless your right by the historical sites rome is like that with its graffiti everywhere.At night we did feel slightly unsafe especially walkin towards the bus stop by the termini station as there ws griups of men everywhere .The hotel itself is basic but has everything you need.We got put in a newer block and our room was the only room that was finished in it so it was scary and having to wall through the courtyard didnt help at night with no lights .The room was small but had a hairdyer shower toiley bday and satalite tv but with no english channels and our blacony bit was a cage around our double windows so we felt a bit closed in.The hotels breakfast consists of 2 rolls and spreads and buuter with juice and a quossont but for the price we paid it was nice enough.There is a member of staffed old man with grey hair and glasses who is very rudde and very unhelpful and in my opinion shouldnt work with the public.On the last day we was informed that you had to pay city tax which we wasnt informed about and im a travel agent and the gaencies in england dont even know about this it is a law as i chedked and was effective from the first jan we should have been told when we checked in not out incase we didnt have enough money.the hotels ok staff ok apart from certain staff members and if ur in a certain block doesnt have any stairs.Rome itself hasnt any nice bars or resturants to be honest and in my opinion the italian people were rude and unhelpful and serving and seating us was an effort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, welcoming, family run Hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Nigel2011098
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a 5 night stay at the Taormina Hotel. Our fourth vist to Rome but first time at the Taormina. We received a very friendly welcome by the owner on arrival and shown to our room which was spacious and elegantly furnished. The bathroom and shower were luxurious. The Hotel was ideally suited for exploring the centre of Rome - easy to walk or great for a range of trams, buses or the Metro. Overall, this Hotel is great value for money and far exceeds it's 2 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: hare25
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Taormina Hotel after reading the other reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is spotlessly clean and all of the staff were extremely helpful. We requested a room at the back of the hotel (as advised by other travellers) overlooking a courtyard which was very quiet. The area is improving and is surrounded by small pizzarias. It is easy to walk all over Rome from here and its not worth taking public transport. The only downside to the hotel is that there's no lift and after a full day walking the long walk up the stairs was a bit of a killer and the beds are a little hard. Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Seniortraveller27
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in 5 star hotels so were worried about staying in a 2 star hotel but we were very pleasantly surprised. The Taormina represented very good value. We asked for a quiet room with a bathroom and extra pillows and nothing was too much trouble. The owner and staff recommended some excellent restaurants, some in the neighbourhood and one in Campo dei Fiori and they also helped us with buses etc.The continental breakfast was fine and we appreciated the English Breakfast tea and decaffeinated coffee. We woulds definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected for a 2-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LMB13_11
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe, so I can not compare this to other places, nor can I comment on value because we purchased a package through a travel agency. However, I can say that the hotel was cleaner and more spacious than I expected. We were in room 229, which I believe was towards the back. Be prepared to carry your own bags up stairs. Our room was quiet and we could open the window when we wanted fresh air. The room was extremely large and the bathroom was more than adequate; although a glass door on the tub would have been nice. When showering, the water soaked the floor (the floor had a drain). Pros - clean, friendly staff, large room, easy walk to train station & metro & buses . Cons - very hard bed, neighborhood. My husband is 6'3", so I never felt unsafe, but I did not care for the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: chetxsteadman
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful... far better than what we expected from a 2-star hotel. The glass shower could have been in a 5-star hotel (well, maybe not, but it was pretty awesome). The owner is exceptionally nice... we talked to him a little while, and he brought us cappuccino from the bar! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: devonsheepy
Reviews.Content: the room was very clean, of a good size and recently decorated. breakfast was pretty basic, but adequate. near to the metro, a supermarket and the oldest ice cream parlour in rome! a 20 minute walk to the colloseum, forum which was tiring after a long day on your feet! get the metro back as it's only 1 euro. towels not changed daily, but room was cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Nootje
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot about the hotel I know roughly what to expect. I am really not that picky but I do have some complains this time. We did not ask for a room at the back because it's winter time so we did not have to open the window/door. The noise of the street must be easy to deal with. But that was the biggest mistake. You can hear everything happend on the street. Too much noise in the corridor. You just hear everything very loud! Bad luck for us that the neighbors from the room next door were also fighting in the middle of the night. Our room was clean. Bed was uncomfortable to sleep on. Bathroom was clean and ok but the shower was very small, even for a small asian person like me. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel so no opinion about that . Breakfast room looked fairly well. Location is good but I would prefer to stay closer to the center next time. Staff was friendly and helpful, nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, good location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: mattandjess100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is priced to suit budget travelers and yet offers much more in my opinion. It is within walking distance to the main train/bus station in rome(termini) and 5 minutes walk on the same road is an underground stop(vittorio emmanuelle). In this sense it is in a very good position for exploring rome and you can buy underground day passes which are accepted on both public rail and buses for next to nothing. The area the hotel is in can look a bit intimidating because of graffiti but we never once felt unsafe and we were out to all hours of the night sightseeing and dining out. The staff and service was fantastic with staff happy to help you in any way. The breakfast was basic but enough to keep you going to lunch. Our room was a double and very generous in size and what stood out was the cleanliness. Overall a very good stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea....sorry”
Reviews.Author: VickiHalleland757
Reviews.Content: I really did a lot reading on Tripadvisor about this hotel and felt for the money it would ok. Not really what I had hoped for. I am by no means that picky but I was somewhat disappointed. Took us awhile to find and when we did it was on a busy street and when you walked in the front door, you were met with stairs!! We had huge heavy suitcases and though my son was capable of carrying it all...we were exhausted by the time we got there from the train station. I went upstairs to check in while my son waited downstairs and the gentleman behind the desk...seeing I was winded...was very short and curt when I asked if we could get some help and if we could be some placed somewhere there were no more stairs. He finally helped my son and showed us to our room that was in a maze of twists and turns. We had to at one point leave the building, walk across a courtyard and into another building and further through the maze. The room was small as I expected. Our "view" was of some ugly roof tops and other people apartments. ..the smell was nice though when they cooked at night!! The bed was like sleeping on a rock but after a day of touring...who cared. The breakfast was ok...no complaints. If you are young and/or in great shape this is the hotel for you, because it is a trek to all the sites. Taxi ride to the hotel from Piazza Navone was 8 euros. Back from the Vatican it was around 12 euros.... make sure you take a few business cards from the hotel to give to the taxi drivers...not many know of the hotel. If you are sick of eating Italian there are plenty of Chinese and Indian food restaurants in the area...lol. All in all it was ok but I would prefer to stay closer to the sites and a 'nicer" part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard A B 1
Reviews.Content: I have recently had a short break at the Taormina Hotel. I selected this hotel as I wanted a base close to the important sites in Rome; it was a good choice. The room was basic and cleaned well daily. The reception staff were very helpful in providing assistance for local facilities, maps of the city and how to get to the various places.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of stairs, fee for air, noise from maid staff, and light with key only”
Reviews.Author: RtLuvr22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just okay, it was annoying to have to carry our luggage up two flights of stairs only to be offered half hearted help after we were half way up. But the annoying truth is that there is a back door that leads to a lift. If you stay here, go in the door to the left of this main entrance and go around to the back. The stairs will be an issue for anyone with handicap issues or those with multiple suitcases. When we arrived we were told that they didn’t have any more double rooms inspite of having a reservation, Mike expected us to be okay with sharing a bed and wiith moving the next day. I stood my ground and he found us a triple room which was spacious compared to most rooms in Europe, and clean. In order to use the lights in the room, you must have your key in the wall, they don’t tell you how to manipulate the lights here, and since we had never seen anything like this we had all lights on or none. Once you have your key in the wall, you can use lights normally with their switches. It was hot when we arrived and since we had read that this hotel had air-conditioning we expected it to be cool in our room. Air-conditioning costs an additional 5 euro a night. Breakfast was prepackaged breads, coffee and tea, and a juice machine. It’s more of a morning snack and nothing worth waking up early for. I would rather have free air-conditioning than the advertised breakfast included. I wouldn’t stay here again, simply because there are so many other options for value in Rome. It wasn’t the worst place I have ever stayed and some of the staff is friendly and helpful, but the place is in need of some repair and there we people right outside our window at night when we were trying to sleep. We had the window open because of the heat, but had to close it because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a budget hotel - convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: wcheah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Good reviews on tripadvisor but we were not expecting much in a budget hotel. Location was very convenient - literally 2 blocks from Metro and 15 min walk from S. Termini. Neighborhood is really run down but we had no problems. Hotel was very spacious and had character/charm. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was huge and breakfast was good, if basic. Wonderful gelatoria just a block away - our last stop every night for gelato before heading to bed! On the negative, traffic noise was load when windows were open. No A/C but fan worked well. Large bed but not very plush. House keeping was a little odd - did not change towels or restock soap/tp. Overall a very nice place. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: opinto
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights end of August/beggining of September 2010. Location: Near Termini train Station (5 minutes walking if you choose the right exit).Tip: Exit first stairst on your left as you get out the train from FCO. It´s about 1 km from Coloseum, so you can walk there if you want.The metro/Subway is at Piazza Victor Emanuel, 2 minutes walking from the hotel.Though the area at night may look dubious ( there´s grafitty at every pulldown door onnthe street), I never felt unsafe. You can find a supermarket on the same street, one of the oldest Icescream makers of Rome and across the street, a Kebab/Pizzaa/Burger spot. The hotel: A good sized room, with AC, very clean.The bathroom looks new an , though very small. The breakfast is very simple and consisted of bread, industrial bakery, some juices or butter, and coffe/milk.That´s it.Staff was nice and helpfull If you want a clean,reasonably well located hotel, and inexpensive hotel, you cannot go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Taormina Hotel is a great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Olemissone
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and our moms spent a few days at this hotel after a trip to Paris. It's a charming hotel. Everyone made us feel so welcome. The service was top-notch. The front desk attendants were so helpful. And the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Usually in Europe, hotel rooms are small and the bathrooms leave a lot to be desired. But not here. We were very pleased with our stay and would love to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's ideal value tourist base”
Reviews.Author: Adrian&Elena
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from four days staying at the Taormina Hotel, which we booked after reading these reviews. We found this to be the perfect base for a tourist visit to Rome, being only 10 minutes walk from Rome's main Termini train station. There is a direct 30-minute rail link between Fumicino Airport and Termini Station, so it was easy to get to. Not recommended if you have a car though, as street parking is limited We were greeted by Arian on the front desk, who was very friendly and helpful. All the staff were extremely pleasant and provide you with a free tourist map and advice on arrival. We had read reviews about rooms at the front of the hotel being noisy, as it is right on a main road with trams running up and down outside til late. Therefore, we sent an e.mail to the hotel the day before we arrived, requesting a room not at the front. We were very pleased that they allocated a room at the back that overlooked a small courtyard and was just perfect, being nice an quiet. The hotel has over 100 rooms and is deceptive by its outward appearance. All corridors and floors appeared to be newly tiled and decorated throughout with corridor lights that were illumiated by motion sensors. Our room was spacious with a nice comfortable bed with nice clean, crisp sheets and the en-suite was also spotlessly clean and well decorated. Breakfast was the usual Continental style with rolls, jams etc and a coffee machine that made superb coffee! The rolls were fresh daily and the breakfast was quite adequate for the day ahead. The location of the Taormina meant that we could walk to all the main attractions within about 30 minutes. Some evenings we returned quite late, but never felt unsafe on the streets. If you stick to the main roads, there are plenty of tourists and police everywhere, so we never felt intimidated. For a 2-star hotel, we found it had everything we needed for a city break and would recommend it to anyone for good value.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay here”
Reviews.Author: fidsHereford
Reviews.Content: this was a lovely hotel clean and basic with lovely staff and within walking distance of all the sight's and load's of places to eat if i was going back again i would definatley stay here and we found a lovely little pub called the old marconi lovely food not too expensive and lovely helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Pedro S
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is a few minutes from termini station. You can get from the Fumicino Airport by train. The Leonardo Express train cost about 14 Euros. We took the taxi (3 people with three luggages) and paid 40 Euros. From the Termini Station (5 minutes walk from the hotel) you can get to the historic Rome and the Vatican is only in a couple of minutes by train and you can even walk to the Colosseum from the Hotel(If you visit the Vatican I recommend doing the reservation prior to your visit to avoid the big lines). There is a supermarket at few steps from the hotel and the historical Ice Cream Factory “Palazzo del Freddo Giovanni Fassi “ with excellent price. The Front Desk staff is very helpful and always willing to assist. Everything was clean and the breakfast gives you a good start of the day and enough energy to explore Rome and enjoy the vacation. I recommend this hotel and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Wyeth41
Reviews.Content: We came in on the slow train from Florence that stops at the back of the Termini. By asking questions we found that it was an easy walk to the hotel with luggage and the same was true when we took the train to the airport on leaving. The walk to the front of the Termini with the express trains is more than twice as long. We had to walk up two flights to our room in a maze where we got lost on the first day. We were not bothered by the two fresh hard roll limit for breakfast as they had unlimited packaged soft rolls and several kinds of packaged hard break and an excellent packaged cheese. The various kinds of coffee options and the two different orange juices in the machine were excellent. We stayed 3 days but did not like the nearby subway. It had 3 exits with long tunnels and we got lost twice on coming home. We also got lost finding the Spanish Steps from the Spagna station as we took an extremely long wrong tunnel. The desk clerk sold us tickets for 4.5 Euros for unlimited rides per day was a bargain and we found everything we wanted via buses. One odd thing, was that there was a prong on your room key that you had to stick in a hole to turn on the lights and it was difficult finding this hole in the dark. We had a room on the street and the all night tram was quite noisy even with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Edjamro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the end of February 2010 as part of a package tour. It was a great experience. The staff was efficient and friendly, and my single room was comparatively spacious. The hotel is well located for all sorts of travel, both local (it's right on a tram line) and farther afield (it's right by Termini). I would recommend to anyone who treats their hotel as a base of operations.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need for a weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EsmeEssexUK
Reviews.Content: The first thing which struck me about the hotel on arriving in Rome, was how easy it was to get to. When you get off at the airport there is a direct train to Termini for 11 Euro each and the hotel was only a 10 minute walk from Termini station. There was a positive and a negative for its location, the positive being that you could get anywhere very easily, with both the train and the metro being on your door step, both of which were cheap and easy to use. It also meant wherever you went, it was easy to find your way back from. However, it wasn't the most pleasant area, we didn't feel unsafe as such, just a bit uncomfortable. But we spent very little time in and around the hotel anyway so it wasn't much of an issue. The staff were very friendly, the rooms were clean and modern, We were a bit dissapointed there was no electrical outlets in the rooms, i'm guessing so you don't use excessive electricity, but there was a t.v. and a hairdryer so unless you wanted to charge anything, there wasn't need for them. The breakfast left much to be desired, coffee and 'juice' with two bread rolls, sum jam and chocolate spread. But it filled a hole. Overall it wasn't particularly glamorous but the safe was free, the rooms were clean and spacious, and the location was great, once we knew where we were going, we could walk to the Trevi Fountain in 15 minutes. It is exactly what you need for this kind of trip. And I would recomend a trip to Rome to anyone, we booked the whole holiday with Easyjet and it was really reasonably priced, the food out there is amazing (especially the ice cream) the sights are out of this world, particularly the Vatican, although I would recommend spending a bit more money and getting a guide as you could be walking around clueless for days in there and the audio guides are rubbish! Although we found the buses and trams a bit tricky to suss out, the metro was brilliant and only 4 Euro for an all day travel card. But if you've got the legs for it, it is relatively easy to walk anywhere you want, we often walked to our destination, often catchin lots of amazing sights on the way, and then got the metro back when we were tried. Villa Borghese and the musuem there are a must, not much is said about them but there were a real highlight. One word of warning, however, don't accept anything from anyone on the street. They walk around with roses and say they want to give you them as a present, then come back 5 minutes later and harass you for the money, the same with the guys doing bracelts on the Spanish Steps, they say it is lucky for them to weave it on you, then try to charge you 10 Euro for a piece of string! So just tell everyone of them to go away!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: colo77
Reviews.Content: this is a great!!! i mean great! hotel, i stayed there with my mother and we thought it was clean, near the metro, and the staff was so helpful!!, the hotel is located in a good area 5min. walk to thge metro and 10min walt to the termini, i mean is just so well located. The rooms are clean and spacious is quite modern, the staff is great since they dont provide internet the guys in the front never had a problem looking for information tha we needed, i mean the were so friendly and helpful (cant stress that enough). all in all, this hotel is well located, very friendly, has good rates, and is clean. i would definitely saty again here my next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Room was very nice (though small) location is okay”
Reviews.Author: pansburg
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, The location is just a few blocks from the subway so you can get anywhere pretty quickly. It is located in an urban setting and the neighborhood after dark can seem a bit sketchy but we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: VaBene001
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely--we selected an interior room overlooking the courtyard so street noise was not a problem. The room was large with two twin beds and a fully appointed bathroom. The reception staff were friendly and had lots of ideas to offer about restaurants, etc. Be aware that although the hotel is only a couple of blocks from the Termini train station, it is actually quite a hike with luggage because there are very few exit/entry points at the TErmini. Nevertheless, the hotel is just a stone's throw from a metro stop (Vittorio Emmanuele). One other small warning: no elevator, so if you can't handle a couple of flights of stairs with your bags, you may wish to find another hotel. I was also disappointed that they did not have wifi, but found an Internet point only a couple of blocks away. Overall--we were very pleased and happy to recommend to other budget-conscious travelers who want a well-located place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pbmusician
Reviews.Content: Very well located a few steps from Vittorio Emmanuelle Metro station, which itself is close to Termini. Hotel has had major refurbishment in terms of decor and furnishings that are worthy of a three star establishment.The room was surprisingly spacious and public areas spotlessly clean but rather clinical ! Breakfasts could be improved with a wider choice of rolls...and not just restircted to two which seemed a little mean..... and some ham to add to the cheese! Top tip...the free tear off maps of Rome at the reception are wonderfully robust and take any amount of folding when out sightseeing. Will be back, and hope the breakfast has had an upgrade by then!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Danyelli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and thought the location was great. Very easy walk to everything (especially loved how we got to walk past the Colosseum on our way back to the hotel each day) and close the metro. We used the metro twice --once to get to Vatican city (although we walked back --very easy walking city) and another time to get to the train station. Never had any concerns about neighborhood safety. Breakfast was minimal but still hearty. Two large freshly baked rolls with choice of cream cheese and various packaged jams and jelly, plus a number of good coffee options (automated machine but I still thought my cappuccino each morning was tasty) plus OJ. Bathroom was modern (although still tiny) and the room we had either had a burned out light or non-working fixture over the bathroom mirror. Overall lighting in entire room was very poor. But it was semi-spacious (for European standard) and I liked that we had CNN on TV to stay connected to the news.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck...”
Reviews.Author: mbnovik
Reviews.Content: Went on a nicely priced get away to Paris/Rome with my gf, booked through gotoday.com. After staying in a hole in wall room (or as my gf said very very basic) in Paris, was pleasantly surprised by Taormina hotel in Rome. We didn’t really figure out the neighborhood - which seemed to be fairly safe. Hotel was located 5 minute walk away from a metro station or a bus. The rumor also was that Coliseum was a brisk 15-20 minute walk away. Anyway, most of the hotel was recently remodeled – I think that they were still in a process of doing that. Marble floors, marble bathroom in good condition. Free safe, 5 euro a night air conditioning charge and other basic amenities. Very friendly stuff. No internet in the hotel. The only odd thing that I can mention is that continental breakfast was from 7 am till 9 am (well you expect to sleep in and relax on a vacation).

Reviews.Title: “don't let the neighborhood fool you, great room”
Reviews.Author: khgo1
Reviews.Content: Was really worried when we pulled up to the front door and it looked like downtown NY. I am so glad we didn't leave. Great room, Great service, breakfast wasn't all that. We got a roll and some juice. But it was very nice after a long day of walking around to go back to a nice, clean room. only thing I didn't like was that they charge you for the A/C

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: km2kg
Reviews.Content: I’ve been of the mind a hotel room should be no more than a place to sleep; this hotel was more than I could ask for. Spacious, updated recently with modern touches, roomy bedroom with a closet and enough room for large suitcases. What I would consider a Huge bathroom and compared to the bathrooms in Florence and Venice it was HUGE. CNN International on television and a small lobby bar for a vino night cap. In the morning a continental breakfast was offered. Although it is not a street over from the major Roman sites being just a street corner away from a metro stop you can't beat it. Also there are stairs to climb to the lobby and to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel near train station....”
Reviews.Author: webbeverly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Taormina 9/8 -9/12/09 and had a pleasant experience. At check in Arvin was very helpful and showed us to our room right away. Our room was small with a small balcony (too small for chairs or a table), the bathroom was actually roomy. One thing is that you are charged 5 euros a day for air conditioning. As there is no elevator you do need to carry your luggage up some stairs, for us it was three flights. The breakfast was small consisting of rolls, ham and variety of cheeses, orange juice and coffee machines. Close to the termini. We would stay there again but not as first choice as we would want to explore other areas.

Reviews.Title: “dodgy area, wierd access arrangements, room fine”
Reviews.Author: charleybeee
Reviews.Content: it is difficult to rate this hotel. we have just returned from a 3-city break and this was the worst of the 3. Whilst our room was quite nice and seemed recently renovated and to a modern specification, the access arrangements were bizarre and the breakfast timings were very limited. The check-in and breakfast room is in an adjacent building to the bedrooms (which were within a private residential block), and entry to the bedrooms required a separate key to the main building, a lift to the 3rd floor (private apartments on the others), a buzzer entry system to get into the corridor with the hotel rooms in, and then finally you were at the door of your hotel. when we first arrived and had the buzzer system explained, we waited ages before the reception buzzed us into the corridor, and they were visibly annoyed over the tannoy and said that we should have only pressed the buzzer once. The thing was that we had been there five minutes trying to get in - it was as if they were away from the reception (adjacent building!) and hadnt heard us buzzing to try and get access. We weren't impressed. The area around the hotel is very run down, but we knew this when we booked so it didnt surprise us. The breakfast arrangements were also very limited, with a 1.5 hour window between 07.30am and 09.00am. Our hotels in Florence and Venice served between 07.00am and 10.00am. Also, unless you venture towards Termini train station there are very few eating and drinking opportunities nearby, so dont expect to come back to the hotel late on in the evening and be able to be fed and watered. Whilst the hotel room itself was fine (air con, TV, modern clean bathroom), the negatives outweighed the positives and it is this elements which will stay with us.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carleton2
Reviews.Content: "If you are visiting Rome for a few days and want a nice clean friendly hotel to rest your tired legs , this is the place ,rooms vary in price , we went for one of the cheaper standard rooms and we were pleasantly surprised . nice comfy bed , lovely en-suite , excellent decoration the staff were so friendly when we go back to Rome again , will definetely book in this place again .5 minute walk from the main Rome Railway station , tram stop nearby .excellent value for money..."

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: ButteredRolls
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at Taormina Hotel during the 2nd week of January 2009. The hotel is conveniently located near the Termini Station. where you can find a tourist information center, post office, train shuttle to the airports, train to Florence, shopping and dining. The staff at the hotel are super friendly and professional, and the rooms are clean and comfortable although on the small side. The neighborhood is not super nice but for a New Yorker, it was perfectly fine for me. All in all, it was a decent place to rest and sleep after a long day of walking and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DAMC
Reviews.Content: I have just come back and I have to say that the hotel is very good. It is about 15 minutes walk from Termini station in an area which, whilst not exactly Beverley Hills, ceratinly wasn't horrendous. I never felt threatened or nervous, walking round the area and with metro station Vittorio Emmanuelle only 5 minutes walk from the hotel, getting round the city was not a problem. The hotel rooms were clean and tidy and the staff courteous and attentive. The only downside was the breakfast-2 bread rolls on your plate and a couple of small pots of jam and a coffe machine. There are no meats/cheezses or cereals. If I go back to Rome I would certainly bear this place in mind.

Reviews.Title: “perfect accomadations”
Reviews.Author: cindylouwho
Reviews.Content: well i was worried about the hotel being a total dive, especially when we pulled up and seen the area at first looked kind of seedy.. well it was totally the opposite. i loved the hotel (except for lugging everything up the stairs!!) they were all very poilte, the room was the largest we stayed in the entire time in italy, the bathroom was nicely sized, and everything was perfectly clean. as for breakfast i actually enjoyed it alot. it was bread with jelly, cheeses, juice, cappucinos etc.. nothing elaborate but remember europeans eat very light breakfast meals, and it was perfect to get some food in our stomach before we left for the day. our window overlooked a courtyard which was very cute, and made u really feel like u "lived" in rome a few days. the area is in the "chinatown" section of rome, and had alot of grafitti and looked kind of sketchy at first, but i think it was the opposite..i always felt safe walking, and it was an easy 10 minute walk to the coloseum. their is even a stop on the train station right around the corner...i would stay there again in a heart beat!!! i love roma!

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel, ghastly area”
Reviews.Author: Nayra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. Our room and bathroom were nice and spacious, done up to a good standard. The window opened onto a typical roman patio with plants in terracotta pots. The front desk staff were at all times polite and helpful. There is also a bar where you can have very good “cappuccinos”, coffee, tea or a drink at competitive prices. Breakfast was basic: Bottled water, artificial “juice” and one of those machines which serves hot drinks and water. The hot drinks were not bad at all and there was an assortment of quality brand tea bags, but since the water was not boiling the results were feeble, as it is usually the case with this system. I would have been happier with just one “croissant”, but there were only crusty white rolls and packed “toasts”, with single serving butter, processed cheese and jams. The hotel –including the reception-- is on the first floor of a building with no lift. There is nothing commendable about the area, but we did not find it dangerous. On the other side of the rails you have the “San Lorenzo” university quarter, much more lively and interesting, with a good choice of restaurants. I cannot comment on the price because we bought a package through an agency.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: Grantville
Reviews.Content: The hotel was consistent with a two star facility -- adequate rooms and well maintained. The front desk staff was helpful at all times. Coffee, beer and wine at reasonable prices at the front desk. Our major disappointment was with the breakfast which was included with the room price. The menu was limited and never varied: coffee or hot water from a machine, two kinds of very sweet juice, two white crusty buns (often hollow) and rusks accompanied by low end single serving jams and cheese. It was a bit much by the third of our eight day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and close to transport...but......”
Reviews.Author: Serenity_H
Reviews.Content: My partner and I planned a travel trip through Europe by train through a travel agent. Our requests were, moderately cheap (but not a complete dive), close to town and pref not MILES away from the train stations so we would have to haul bags all over the city. This hotel is a little ways walk from he thick of things but close to the main train station. The area was a bit "Ghetto" and a little scary to walk back to of a night time. Would not recommend to ladies travelling on their own! The check in was easy enough, the staff weren't going out of their way to be helpful but they were nice enough. WOuld not recommend this to elderly or disabled persons, as there is no lift. harsh after an overnight dodgey train trip wig 2 heavy bags but all good! The room was very basic but for the most part clean...apart from the odd cockroach in the bathroom. Very noisy street down below which made it hard to sleep at night.....and we weren't really going to bed that early. Our continental breakfast was included all mornings and this consisted of 2 very crusty hard bread rolls and jam, and tea coffee or hot chocolate. Do yourself a favour and get a McDonalds breakfast from up the road. The staff there would be more accommodating, the lady on brekky looked like her dog had just died. If you're wanting a place that's not to hard to get around from and is cheap, well this place is for you. But after a hard day of sightseeing, it's not a place to chill out in. Especially with our mates the cockroaches in the bathroom!

HotelInfo.Name: Taormina Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Eugenio 49-51, 00185 Rome, Italy
